com.csm.rover.simulator.objects

Class FreeThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.csm.rover.simulator.objects.FreeThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class FreeThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    An object for creating new threads that run outside of the simulation time step defined in Globals.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Constant for allowing the thread to run continuously

      FreeThread(int interval, java.lang.Runnable run, int times, java.lang.String name, boolean start)

      • FOREVER

        public static final int FOREVER

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FreeThread

        public FreeThread(int interval,
                  java.lang.Runnable run,
                  int times,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Basic constructor, automatically starts the thread. Equivalent to FreeThread(interval, run, times, name, true)
        Parameters:
        interval - Time delay in milliseconds between executions
        run - The runnable to execute
        times - The number of times the thread should run, can be FOREVER
        name - A name to assign to the thread

      • FreeThread

        public FreeThread(int interval,
                  java.lang.Runnable run,
                  int times,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  boolean start)
        Constructor allowing the called to delay the starting of the thread.
        Parameters:
        interval - Time delay in milliseconds between executions
        run - The runnable to execute
        times - The number of times the thread should run, can be FOREVER
        name - A name to assign to the thread
        start - Whether the thread should start now. Can be started later with Thread.start()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Run action for the thread. Should not be called by user. Use Thread.start() to start the thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • Stop

        public void Stop()
        Forces the thread to cease operations.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
